page.title: 12Listed Buildings
page.content: Coombe Farmhouse - An L-shaped 17th Century or earlier house Flegis Court - Once the Manor House for old Hawkinge,near St Michael's Church. Terlingham Manor Farmhouse - One of the manors of Folkestone and mentioned in the Domesday Book. Dane Farmhouse - A 16th Century timber framed building. Hawkinge Hall & Granary-An 18th Century red brick house.Rose Cottage-A small 18th Century cottage.Maypole Farm-Originally the Maypole Inn.17th Century timber building,has connections with smuggling. God's Providence Cottages-on main A260 road.Local history says in 1778 a man trudging up White Horse Hill sat down to rest,and found a large sum of money by the road. The 2 cottages were built with some of the money.White Horse Inn Local Public House,late 18th Century.
